summary: The 'Uyghur Genocide Accountability and Sanctions Act of 2025' addresses human rights abuses against Uyghurs and other ethnic and religious groups in China.  It expands sanctions, denies US entry to those complicit in atrocities, provides support for victims, and promotes cultural preservation. The bill mandates reports on forced organ harvesting, US government contracts, seafood procurement, and propaganda. It also prohibits procurement and commissary sales of seafood from China and requires information gathering on detained family members of US citizens.
